Returns the length of this character sequence. The length is the number * of 16-bit chars in the sequence.
The character sequence from which a subsequence will be * appended.
for Each Remaining
* * A CharSequence is a readable sequence of char values. This * interface provides uniform, read-only access to many different kinds of * char sequences.
Performs this operation on the given argument.
Primitive Iterator
an IntStream of Unicode code points from this sequence

Returns a stream of code point values from this sequence. Any surrogate pairs encountered in the sequence are combined as if by Character.toCodePoint and the result is passed to the stream. Any other code units, including ordinary BMP characters, unpaired surrogates, and undefined code units, are zero-extended to int values which are then passed to the stream.
Outlined helper method for reverse
reverse All Valid Surrogate Pairs
has Surrogates
is Low Surrogate
The * {@code StringBuilder} class should generally be used in preference to * this one, as it supports all of the same operations but it is faster, as * it performs no synchronization.
As of release JDK 5, this class has been supplemented with an equivalent * class designed for use by a single thread,
A mutable sequence of characters.
A thread-safe, mutable sequence of characters.
